description: Update the configuration information for an existing flywheel.

parameters.name: FlywheelArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the flywheel to update.

parameters.name: DataSecurityConfig
parameters.description: Flywheel data security configuration. ModelKmsKeyId (string) --- ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats: KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab" Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab" VolumeKmsKeyId (string) --- ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the volume. VpcConfig (dict) --- Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for the job. For more information, see Amazon VPC. The ID number for a security group on an instance of your private VPC. Security groups on your VPC function serve as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic and provides security for the resources that you'll be accessing on the VPC. This ID number is preceded by 'sg-', for instance: 'sg-03b388029b0a285ea'. For more information, see Security Groups for your VPC. (string) --- The ID for each subnet being used in your private VPC. This subnet is a subset of the a range of IPv4 addresses used by the VPC and is specific to a given availability zone in the VPC's Region. This ID number is preceded by 'subnet-', for instance: 'subnet-04ccf456919e69055'. For more information, see VPCs and Subnets. (string) ---

nested_params.name: ModelKmsKeyId
nested_params.description: ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:

nested_params.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_params.description: ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the volume.

nested_params.name: VpcConfig
nested_params.description: Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for the job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_params.description: The ID number for a security group on an instance of your private VPC. Security groups on your VPC function serve as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic and provides security for the resources that you'll be accessing on the VPC. This ID number is preceded by 'sg-', for instance: 'sg-03b388029b0a285ea'. For more information, see Security Groups for your VPC.

nested_params.name: Subnets
nested_params.description: The ID for each subnet being used in your private VPC. This subnet is a subset of the a range of IPv4 addresses used by the VPC and is specific to a given availability zone in the VPC's Region. This ID number is preceded by 'subnet-', for instance: 'subnet-04ccf456919e69055'. For more information, see VPCs and Subnets.

nested_items.name: FlywheelProperties
nested_items.description: The flywheel properties.

nested_items.name: FlywheelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the flywheel.

nested_items.name: ActiveModelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the active model version.

nested_items.name: DataAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants Amazon Comprehend permission to access the flywheel data.

nested_items.name: TaskConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration about the model associated with a flywheel.

nested_items.name: LanguageCode
nested_items.description: Language code for the language that the model supports.

nested_items.name: DocumentClassificationConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration required for a document classification model.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: Classification mode indicates whether the documents are MULTI_CLASS or MULTI_LABEL.

nested_items.name: Labels
nested_items.description: One or more labels to associate with the custom classifier.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EntityRecognitionConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration required for an entity recognition model.

nested_items.name: EntityTypes
nested_items.description: Up to 25 entity types that the model is trained to recognize.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: An entity type within a labeled training dataset that Amazon Comprehend uses to train a custom entity recognizer.

nested_items.name: DataLakeS3Uri
nested_items.description: Amazon S3 URI of the data lake location.

nested_items.name: DataSecurityConfig
nested_items.description: Data security configuration.

nested_items.name: ModelKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the volume.

nested_items.name: DataLakeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: ID for the KMS key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the data in the data lake.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for the job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The ID number for a security group on an instance of your private VPC. Security groups on your VPC function serve as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic and provides security for the resources that you'll be accessing on the VPC. This ID number is preceded by 'sg-', for instance: 'sg-03b388029b0a285ea'. For more information, see Security Groups for your VPC.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID for each subnet being used in your private VPC. This subnet is a subset of the a range of IPv4 addresses used by the VPC and is specific to a given availability zone in the VPC's Region. This ID number is preceded by 'subnet-', for instance: 'subnet-04ccf456919e69055'. For more information, see VPCs and Subnets.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the flywheel.

nested_items.name: ModelType
nested_items.description: Model type of the flywheel's model.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A description of the status of the flywheel.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: Creation time of the flywheel.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: Last modified time for the flywheel.

nested_items.name: LatestFlywheelIteration
nested_items.description: The most recent flywheel iteration.
